copy: Pat salmon dry with paper towels, then season with salt and pepper.
These are my step directions 2

While chorizo cooks, heat a medium non-stick pan over medium-low heat. When hot, add 4 tbsp butter and swirl pan, until melted. Crack in 4 eggs. Season with salt and pepper. Pan-fry, covered, until egg white is set 2-3 min.
These are my step directions
Divide hash between bowls and top with pan-fried eggs and caramelized. Dollop over aioli. Sprinkle over remaining green onions.

Heat the same pan over medium-high heat. When hot, add oil, then the cut peppers. Cook for 3-4 min, until softened. Add ground chorizo and remaining minced garlic. Break up chorizo into small pieces, and cook for 3-5 min, until no pink remains. Season with salt and pepper. While chorizo cooks, proceed to the next step.

Divide patties, roasted potatoes and sugar snap peas between plates. Stir any juices from the plate with the patties into the thyme-onion gravy, then spoon gravy over patties. Sprinkle with remaining parsley.
Increase speed to medium, and add the eggs one by one, then the egg yolk. Stir until fully incorporated.

Heat a medium pot over medium heat. Add 2 tbsp oil, then half the sliced green onions and half the grated ginger. Cook for a minute until fragrant. Add rice and water. Bring to a boil over high heat. Once boiling, reduce heat to medium-low. Cover and cook, until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed, 12-14 min.
With the mixer on low speed, add flour, oats, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon, blending for about 45 seconds. Don’t overmix.

Heat a large non-stick pan over medium heat. When hot, add 1 tbsp oil, then the flattened patties. Cook until golden-brown, 3-5 min per side. Transfer cooked patties to a plate. Cover with aluminum foil to keep warm. Remove the pan from the heat and drain off any excess fat.
Preheat the oven to 450°F. Cut potatoes into 1-inch pieces. Slice the onion. Peel and mince garlic. Roughly chop parsley. Strip thyme leaves off stems. Trim sugar snap peas.
Use a food processor to mince 2 cloves garlic. Juice the lemon into the food processor. Add 4 tbsp olive oil, 1/4 tsp salt, and 1/4 tsp ground pepper. Process again until well combined.
Add vinegar and sugar into the pan, and season with salt. Cook for 7-8 min, until dark golden-brown. Remove pan from heat, and transfer to another small bowl and set aside. Wipe pan clean carefully.

Heat a medium pot over medium heat. Add 2 tbsp oil, then half the sliced green onions and half the grated ginger. Cook for a minute until fragrant. Add rice and water. Bring to a boil over high heat. Yield should be 2

Preheat the oven to 425°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Cut potatoes into ½-inch cubes. Slice onion. Core and cut pepper into ½-inch pieces. Finely chop parsley. Thinly slice green onions. Halve tomatoes. Peel, then mince garlic.

Pour the batter into the prepared pan and bake for 50 minutes or until browned and burned-looking on top. Keep an eye on the cheesecake from 50 minutes forward. The center will still be quite jiggly, but the cake is ready. Remove from the oven and cool.
Prepare the vegetables by dicing the onion, mincing the garlic, and finely chopping the basil.

Heat the same pan over medium-high heat. When hot, add oil, then the cut peppers. Cook for 3-4 min, until softened. Add ground chorizo and remaining minced garlic. Break up chorizo into small pieces, and cook for 3-5 min, until no pink remains. Season with salt and pepper. While chorizo cooks, proceed to the next step.

Toss the cubed potatoes and oil on the baking sheet. Season with salt and pepper. Roast in middle of oven, flip halfway, and cook until golden-brown, 18-20 min. While potatoes roast, proceed to the next step.

Pour the processed dressing mixture into the salad bowl, and massage into the kale with clean hands to make sure everything is coated well. Add maple syrup and mix again.

Return to the pan with softened onions. Add minced garlic and remaining stripped thyme and cook until fragrant for about a minute. Add beef broth. Simmer for 2-3 min until slightly reduced. Add half the chopped parsley and butter. Season with salt and pepper, and stir until butter melts.

Transfer hummus into a container, cover and refrigerate overnight.

While chorizo cooks, heat a medium non-stick pan over medium-low heat. When hot, add 4 tbsp butter and swirl pan, until melted. Crack in 4 eggs. Season with salt and pepper. Pan-fry, covered, until egg white is set 2-3 min.
